keyword: how many calories in 1 scrambled egg
title: How Many Calories in 1 Scrambled Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 1 scrambled egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 Scrambled Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), scrambled with 1 tsp butter, no milk or additional ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and recipe; check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One scrambled large egg has about 100 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Values align with standard Nutrition Facts labels for quick comparison.

tweaks.label: Use oil instead of butter (1 tsp)

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 100 kcal for a large egg scrambled with 1 tsp butter.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 6.5 g protein per large scrambled egg.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have more calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added fats like butter; plain scrambled is closer to boiled at ~78 kcal.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Added butter or oil increases calories; non-stick pan with no fat keeps it lower.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: One large scrambled egg has ~210 mg cholesterol, mostly from the yolk.
